body.p:
Frankfort August 22nd 1865
Hon Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky
Sir

We respectfully reccommend to you, the release from confinement ^of^ A. Seaton, a prisoner in the Kentucky Penitentiary. He has been confined to the hospital for five months past, sinking from a chronic disease of consumptive character. His relatives have expressed a willingness and ability to take care of him.

In cases like the above, where the ends of justice can no longer be subserved by retaining the prisoner, and he can be well provided for outside, and his impaired physical condition being an impediment in the way of further transgression, we consider the liberation a benefit to the institution as well as humanity to the unfortunate inmate.

Very Respectfully
J. M. Mills
John S. Hays } Inspectors Ky Penitentiary
I concur in the above recommendation

J. L. Phythian
Physician to the Ky Penitentiary
